headline: Easy Lemon Bars
description: The bars are great and easy to make hope you like them.
name: Easy Lemon Bars
recipeIngredient: 1 (18.25 ounce) package lemon cake mix with pudding

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Pour cake mix into a large bowl. Add the egg and oil; mix until well blended. Mixture will be slightly dry. Reserve one cup for the topping, and pat the rest into an ungreased 9x13 inch pan.

Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Set aside to cool. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, beat the cream cheese with the sugar and lemon juice until smooth. Spread the mixture evenly over the baked crust. Crumble the reserved cake mix mixture over the top.
Bake for an additional 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until filling is set and the topping is lightly toasted. Cool before cutting into bars. Refrigerate leftovers.

review.reviewBody: Sprinkled a little powdered sugar over the top before cutting into squares.
Came out great but I followed some of the other suggestions including doubling the filling and using 5 tablespoons of lemon juice. I don’t think it would have an a filling if you don’t double it?.
Very easy and everyone enjoyed the bars!

These are delicious, EASY and have potential for a lot of possibilities!

I didn't have the cake mix w the pudding so I added half a pkg of vanilla pudding instead. Probably because of that, it looked like I didnt have enough of the crust so I used a 9x9 pan instead.

Next time I will use way more lemon(will use lemon zest), and will maybe swirl a bit of all fruit jam into the filling.

Great recipe - thank you!
I used a 9x9 pan instead

This is an excellent recipe that I will use over and over again, without a doubt. Cooking for me is an art, not a science, so yes, I am one of those who changes recipes. This time it was necessary. I live in Guatemala and many things that are available in other countries just are unheard of here. I used a French Vanilla cake mix, but it is much smaller so had to use all of it to cover my pan. I added lime zest to the crust and the juice of a lime as well. For the topping, I took advice of others and almost doubled the ingredients, using the first lemon from my tree. Limes are abundant here, but not lemons. I wish I had added more juice and more zest, because the flavor when cooked was really mild. Delicious, but very mild. I like it tarter. I covered the top with coconut and that worked really well. 

I really liked the chewy crispness of the crust, and the cheesecake on top is excellent. Thanks for a terrific recipe that I will be tinkering with for a long time.
Super easy recipe! I did take the advice of others and doubled the filling and also doubled the amount of lemon juice. It was a big hit! thanks for a great recipe!
Very easy to make. They are delicious! Very addictive!
These were so easy to make! My grandson loved them! I gave them 4 stars because I like my lemon bars more lemony .....if that’s a word. Next time I will add more lemon juice

The only thing that I had trouble with is the package size of the cake mix; it's hard to find a cake mix that is 18.25 oz. I used a 15.25 oz box. The bottom crust after it cooled seemed tough but when you put them in fridge overnight, it softens to a great texture. Good reviews from friends and family on recipe! thank you for posting it!
Oh my! These are great. Really satisfies that craving for lemon.

After reading other comments I planned to add extra cream cheese. Did not have any, so I added 1/2 cup of sour cream. Also added lemon zest to cream cheese and sprinkled a little on the topping. My crust was very moist so I added a box of instant vanilla pudding to help dry it up. Then I a few tablespoons of flour to the crust I saved for the topping. The topping looked much better.

These are wonderful lemon cheesecake bars! I doubled the filling, and tripled the lemon juice plus I added some lemon zest. I baked for 15 min to set the crust, but it took about 30 min to set the filling and brown the topping. I live at high altitude, everything takes longer. Plus I did double the filling. So good! Definitely a keeper!
I love this recipe and so do my daughters! I double the filling, just a personal preference for a little thicker bar, but that is the only change I make. So easy and so Yummy!

I just think the recipe directions need some reworking. I felt like after I removed 1 cup of the dough I really didn't have enough left to adequately cover the bottom of a 9x13 pan. So I added about 1/4 cup back in. After the first bake, I'm thinking that maybe it just is meant to be spread more thinly than I thought as it does puff up nicely. It would have been more difficult to cover completely, but maybe the directions should mention that it will be quite a thin base. After the first bake it does say to cool while making the cream cheese mixture. Perhaps it should say to cool for at least 30 minutes as my mixture got quite melty and difficult to spread on the, still warm, base. That said, it was very easy to make and they taste great. And this recipe would lend itself to many different flavors: chocolate cake with peppermint flavoring or vanilla cake with almond flavoring all would be delicious as well.
I could tell by reading the recipe that the filling was not going to be enough so I added a third more. I still think it is lacking, it's more like a cookie than a soft bar.
Easy and yummy! Just the right amount of lemon flavor. This recipe is a keeper!

We loved this recipe. The only changes I made, were ones that I got from other reviews. I doubled the filling, added more lemon juice, and for the "crust" I used lemon juice and zest (vanilla cake and vanilla pudding mixes). Very lemon-y! This got great reviews! Thank you :)
Outstanding and delicious! Great dish for party dessert!
Yummy as written. However, we decided after making it as written that it really needed just a little more filling so we will double filling next time.

I really like this recipe. It looks and tastes great. I did make several modifications, however. I doubled the filling. I increased the lemon juice to 3-4 tablespoons (I used fresh squeezed). I added the freshly-grated zest from one lemon into the cream cheese mixture. I used melted butter instead of the oil. I mixed in sliced almonds with the topping. I baked it for about 7 minutes longer than the recipe stated because of the increased filling which included 2 minutes on a 380 degree broil because it wasn't browning very well.

I did add the small package of lemon pudding, also doubled the cream cheese, added 2 T. lemon zest I had previously grated and frozen plus the T. lemon juice. It came out pretty good for not being totally homemade plus easier to make.
Did not like the taste.
These are very easy and delicious, although should be made in a 9x9 pan as they were very thin from a 9x13 pan.

I changed the amount of lemon juice to 2/3 cup and added an extra tablespoon of flour to lemon topping mixture. Well, they were delicious....I just need to figure out the cooking time for my oven. First batch I over baked the crust (35 minutes) batch #2 under baked (27 minutes) ughh, I read a review that said better to over cook the crust than under cook. She was RIGHT! They still taste great, I'll try batch #3 soon.

I have never made lemon bars before, so I was relying on suggestions and the recipe alone to be wonderful, and it was! I brought these to parent teacher conferences and several teachers told me how much they loved them! A couple even asked for the recipe. Note that I did also double the cream cheese filling part as some others had suggested. Because of this, they baked for probably 15 extra minutes. I just kept checking them every 5 minutes or so until I felt like it was generally firm and the top was browned. I also placed some powdered sugar in a fine strainer so I could sprinkle some on top- it made them looked more finished.
Sad these for a bridal shower. Followed recipe except did add more lemon, at least didn't measure and kept squeezing. I also added zest to cream cheese. Everyone loved them
This is such an easy recipe and everyone raves about it! One of my favorites for sure! So lemony.
These are my favorite!
Will never make again, sorry. Tastes processed and soggy.

I made these bars as directed except I used a cake mix that did not have pudding. They were still fantastic, very easy and will make again. I like them better after they are refrigerated. Thanks for a great recipe!

This was an absolute hit at card club. I took the advice of other reviewers. Doubled the filling, added 5 additional Tbs. Of lemon juice and made a drizzle for the top of lemon juice and powdered sugar. I couldn't find cake mix with pudding so I added a box of instant lemon pudding. Absolutely sensational!

These were GREAT! As others suggested I doubled the cream cheese, used a scant 1/2 C sugar and more lemon juice. They did take longer to cook with the extra cream cheese and lemon juice. I will try to use lemon zest next time and/or more lemon juice, but WILL make again. Also, they were better the next day (good thing there were some left over).
LOVE

Wow! Fantastic and easy! I followed recipe exactly except I used the juice from one lemon - approx 4 tbsps, and then zested the lemon and added zest to the cream cheese mixture. Will definitely make again!
Made for Superbowl and they were heavenly!

This is a great recipe. The only change I made was to increase the lemon juice to 1/4 cup, after reading reviews that 1 T. wasn't lemony enough. My husband HATES lemons and lemon-flavored anything, but said these were good and that even with the increased lemon juice, were not overpowering. All the reviews saying the filling should be doubled, I don't agree - I thought the amount of filling was perfect for a lemon bar, which I think of being more of a cookie rather than cakelike. To each his own! I will definitely make again! (Also, I used a plastic tumbler to roll over the crust in the pan, rather than pressing it with my fingers...much faster and less mess!)
These disappeared FAST! I used lemon cake mix & sm box of instant lemon pudding.
SUPER FANTASTIC, so easy

I made this recipe exactly as written, they came out perfect! And I won best tasting cookie at the cookie swap I made them for. For the crumbly bottom layer, you just have to really PRESS the crumbs in and they work out perfect.

These were delicious!!!! I could not have been more pleased. I had to improvise some though. 

My store did not have the lemon cake mix with the pudding. So I ended up using Duncan Hines lemon supreme cake mix. I added to it a small box of Jello instant lemon pudding mix. No milk, just the dry powder. I doubled the filling layer. To the filling I added the juice of a small lemon (no measuring) I baked the crust 15 min just like the recipe says. To get the topping to cover I used my hand to finely and evenly sprinkle it over the filling mixture. I had to bake it 20 mintes for the filling to set. I refrigerated them before cutting and serving them. They turned out perfect!

Pretty good--definitely needs a lot more lemon juice--I added lemon juice until the filling tasted about right to me. That was my only deviation from recipe, except I had to bake it about an extra 15 minutes (30 approximately) to get some toasty golden brown onto the top crust.

These are excellent lemon bars! But after making them per the recipe, I did tweak future batches. First, I now leave out the cream cheese filling and substitute lemon curd. Adds a great burst of lemon to this bar and makes this easy dessert even easier since I use jarred lemon curd! Second, please don't let this try and brown on top, even slightly. You will have dry bars. Just bake until the top is set, and you are good to go! Moist, delicious and super lemony!
Loved it! And I made it EXACTLY like it said. It was delish!

I made these lemon bars - haven't tasted them yet. But one problem I had was that the lemon cake mix was only 15.25 oz, not the 18.25 oz and I could not find a bigger one. I did complain to Betty Crocker. I added a little flour but the topping was still not crumbly and didn't really brown. Don't know how they will taste, but I don't think that there is quite enough filling. I am trying them for a party but may end up eating them myself if they don't turn out right. May have to go back to my mother's recipe which always turns out but is a bit harder.
when i eat lemon bars 2 years ago they tasted very good, you all sould bake some sometime this year.
Love love love this recipe. Foolproof delicious and very packable for boat lunches and horseback trips. Try it you'll love it!
I just made the recipe and loved them the way they are. Am taking them to a pinochle party of 12 and will share the recipe with the women. Betty F.
Made just as recipe said. So good. Quick and easy. Husband and granddaughter loved them. Am going to make again this weekend.

This was actually so disappointing. I'm always skeptical about using boxed cake mixes and this recipe just confirms that scepticism. It tasted so fake and processed, and you could barely even taste the lemon despite me increasing the amount of lemon in there. Would not recommend this to anyone.

EXCELLENT! I did as others suggested, doubled the filling, but I ALSO doubled the cake mix part. I used 2 lemon cake mixes with pudding in the mix (Betty Crocker), ADDED 1 small box of instant lemon pudding, 2 eggs & 1 C. oil and 1 Tbl Lemon Extract (1/2 mixture into 9 x 13, 1/2 mixture for top). Then for the FILLING, I used 3 pkgs, 2/3 C. sugar, 1/4 C. lemon juice, yellow coloring AND 3 EGGS (so it would firm while cooking). Baked about 30 mins until topping browned and middle firmed... EXCELLENT.

Wonderful recipe. Brought these to work and my coworkers loved them, so did my boyfriend. The only note I would make is that 15 min in the oven might be a little too much (at least for my oven) on the second part of the baking process. Bottom got a little burnt, so watch that time. Otherwise, Awesome! I'll be making more this weekend.

So delicious! I added a box of sugar-free instant lemon pudding to the crust along with a teaspoon of lemon extract. I reduced the sugar to 1/4 cup in the filling and used the juice of one large lemon because I like my lemon bars tart. I agree with some other reviews and suggest doubling the filling. I made my bars in an 11 x 7 in. pan and everything came out perfect. I will be making these again and again!!
Yum! Some lemon bars are so sweet, but these are just right!
Double cream cheese filling.

Made changes as suggested by others and these were AWESOME!! This is one of those things that tastes and looks so good you will find it hard to believe you made it yourself. Notes for next time: Used 12 oz cream cheese and a bit less than 1/2 cup sugar. Used the zest from one lemon and 1/4 c. lemon juice (from 1 1/2 lemons), put 1/3 of the zest and a Tablespoon of juice in with the cake mix and the rest of the zest and juice in the cream cheese filling. Cooked as directed but with the extra liquid it needed about 25 minutes for the second stay in the oven instead of 15. Dusted with powdered sugar once it was cool. Soooooo yummy!!

This is a great recipe, easy and I too got loads of compliments.
Changes I made... 
I doubled the filling as suggested 
Used golden cake mix and small package of lemon putting mix.
Juiced lemons, half a lemon in the crust and 1 1/2 in the filling. 
Zested the lemon rind and put zest from half a lemon in the crust and zest from 1 1/2 lemons in the filling. 
I added lemon extract to the filling and some yellow food coloring for presentation.
I found when baking, after 20 minutes the top crust was not toasting, so I put the oven on broil for just a minute and it came out perfect.
Sprinkled with icing sugar also.
A big hit and truly easy! I made 1.5 times the filling and used 4 tablespoons of lemon juice. These were even better the next day, they need time to sit!

Make these for a bake sale to try them out. I love lemon so I too added 5 tbsp of lemon juice instead of the 1 tbsp. Very quick bars to throw together at the last minute! Great bars and had people asking for the recipe!

This recipe has a good flavor and consistency.
I added half of a lemon zest.
It's a good lemon bar, but the best I one 
that I have ever had comes from the 
recipe book called 101 things to do with a 
cake mix:)

Just like other reviewers, I found that there was not enough filling. The cake mixture that you're supposed to save to crumble on the top expanded in the oven - when i took the bars out of the oven, they resembled Barney Rubble bars! Taste was fair....

My husband seemed to really like these but I just don't really care for fruity type desserts. He said he would like me to make again so that makes it a winner for me. They were easy to make which was a huge plus! Also I didn't find mix with pudding so I used plain lemon cake mix and I used lemon extract in place of lemon juice since I did not have it. It seemed to work out fine.

I wouldn't have believed it. I was desperate for a non-dairy lemon bar recipe and all I had handy was HALF a box of lemon cake mix, some lemons and some Tofutti cream cheese (half a tub). I prepared the recipe exactly as directed, using HALF an egg (broken in a cup and stirred well) in the cake mix and HALF in the "cream cheese" mixture. Well, I wasn't expecting much, but it was actually very tasty, with almost no taste of cake mix at all! Made in a smaller pan, obviously, and I would recommend making a full-sized batch ... if only because everybody's going to want seconds!
Tasted too much like cake. Its also very heavy and thick. I'll eat what I made, but won't be making it again.
Too dry

YUM! I'm not a huge craver of lemon stuff but these are just delicious! I made two small changes per previous reviews. 1) I doubled the filling. Hey, I AM a craver of cream cheese and figured it wouldn't hurt. :) and 2) I added a Tbls of lemon juice with some zest into the cake mix. I might add some more next time just to make it a little more tart but they're yummy as is. Thank you so much for the recipe!! They sure were easy - except for the 2nd trip to the store because I was out of sugar. Haha!
Very easy and very good. Popular at my afternoon tea party.

I can't overemphasize how easy this recipe is. More specifically, how easy this crust is. And cheap. For about $1 you have a perfect crust. I was a little concerned how thin it was, but it expanded while cooking and was great. I'm going to use this crust recipe for all sorts of bars now. A great shortbread crust is good, but with the cost of butter these days, this takes the cake! The filling was also good, although I prefer a traditional lemon bars topping over this cream cheese one.

As published, it's a 4 star recipe, pretty good & ridiculously easy. Once the numerous reviewer recommendations are incorporated, it's a 5+ star delight. What I did: coarsely shredded rind of 1 lemon added to crust mixture. 1/4 c sliced almonds added to reserved top crust mixture. Combined 1/4 c fresh lemon juice w/ low fat cream cheese, 4 oz tub of lemon yogurt, 11 drops of NuStevia extract to filling. Bake as directed.

Oh my goodness!!! I just made these bars and they are WONDERFUL! I did double the filling, based on other reviews, and I added lemon juice to the filling and the crust. These are much better than traditional lemon bars!
Love them!
I have made these lomon bars about 10 times over the last few years and they are super easy and everyone loves them!

Yummy! I like these bars better than traditional lemon bars. The crumble topping is very good. I took the advice of other viewers and added the juice from half of a lemon and also zest from half of a lemon to the crust mixture. I also added extra juice and more zest to the filling and they turned out with lots of lemon flavor. They are good as is but next time I will double the filling as some others suggested to see if I like it better. Overall, this is a very good and easy recipe.

Definitely easy. These are not quite as good as a true lemon bar, but are still great. I took these to work and they were all gone by the end of the school day. I had no problems with assembly, and although the crust seemed thin when I was pressing it into the pan, it did puff up and was fine. I let these cook to room temperature and then refrigerated over night, which made them cut easily and cleanly.

These were so easy and tasted great. I made them for a work function and they were a big hit. I used the juice from half a lemon in the base, and the juice from the other half, along with the zest from the lemon for the filling. I dusted the top with icing sugar before serving. I will definitely be making them again.
Just made these for my Grandkids as an after school snack...they LOVED them, as did hubby when he got home! Thanks for sharing:-)
These are very very good. I took the suggestion of others and doubled the filling recipe. Also used three tablespoons of lemon juice. Sooooooo good!
OMG, I love these. So easy! I didn't want to tell the girls at work that I made them from a cake mix.
Very yummy! Hard to press evenly into 13X9, but necessary since bottom crust puffs up quite a bit.

I made these for a church picnic. Can you say simple!! These were pretty good but I did add more lemon juice to the cream cheese filling. I would probably add some lemon juice or lemon zest to the crust next time as well. They werent SUPER lemony but still very good. They were all gone so they were well liked!

very good, so rich and creamy, I tried some suggestions others had made, I mixed cake mix and added the pudding mix, I doubled the filling and used about 5tbsp of lemon juice in total and about 1tsp of zest, and some yellow food colouing to the filling. I made this and another lemon bar recipe from this site (Lemon Coconut Squares) at the same time to see which everyone prefered and this got the most votes with everyone also commenting on how great the crust was

I've been making these lemon bars for years, I believe this recipe was originally from Duncan Hines. I remember my mom copying it from Good Housekeeping magazine many years ago. :) I always thought the bars were delicious and easy to prepare but a little too thin. To remedy the problem, I started making a double batch and using a small browie pan for the "second" pan. Doing this gives you enough to make the whole bath a little thicker. I also agree with others that add some extra lemon juice or lemon zest...gives a more lemony flavor.
Super easy- a big hit!

LOVE these! My mom used to make these back in the 80's and she had gotten the recipe from a magazine I think. I am so glad I found this recipe on here! I like to add the lemon zest and juice from one lemon too!

This recipe was great as is. I didn't change a thing. I was craving something lemony sweet and this was perfect. It hit the spot and the kids liked it too! It was really easy to make. I will definitely keep this recipe on hand.
These were terrible! All I could taste was the fake lemon almost chemical taste from the lemon cake mix. Even my kids wouldn't eat these and I ended up throwing out the whole pan.
Excellent lemon bars, both tart and sweet, and my husband's favorite.
Took these along on a campout and they were a big hit. Followed recipe exactly and I would definitely make them again. Thanks!

The cake crust bottom was thick and hard as a rock - like a few day old lemon cook left out on a dish. I doubled the cream cheese filling and it still spread so thin like a light frosting - quadrupling the batch would have equaled a "FILLING" and perhaps would have kept the crust moist - ? How she got away with just one batch of filling is a wonder!!
EASY Breezy! Yummy for your tummy! I made these for my Christmas gifts and everyone raved about the recipe! A keeper for sure. The easiest Lemon Bars I have ever made! Thanks Peggy!

This recipe got me 2nd place in a cookie contest today! It was a big hit. I made a double batch and the only thing I might change for next time is using less cake mix for the bottom crust because it was very thick. I added a pack of instant lemon pudding mix in with the crust as well. I did double the of filling so for a double batch I used 4 cream cheese. I used 2 fresh lemons for lemon juice and also put a little lemon zest in with the cream cheese filling and another pack of lemon instant pudding mix. I baked it with the filling and crust crumbled on top for about 25 minutes. Do let it completely cool before cutting to cut smoothly. They stay very moist. I rate this 5 stars and will bake again!

Actually, I have to disagree with the reviewers who double up the cream cheese filling. I DO agree with adding more lemon flavor. My version added the juice and zest of one lemon. Even our pickiest family member said these are the best. And he's a chocoholic! Thanks so much for sharing this.
I LOVED this recipe but will probably never make it again. It was two good, I could probably clear a pan alone.
These are fantastic! I did follow other suggestions and doubled the filling. I also added extra lemon juice (4 tbsp total). I've sent this recipe to a few people to try!!

This was the best recipe ever for Lemon Bars. I've made them for my family several times as well as for an office cookie party. There wasn't one left over, so you know they were good. I have finicky eaters at the house too, and they loved them. It's a great and easy recipe, and well worth trying - you will not be disappointed. :-)

I love these bars. So quick n easy to make. Cheap too. Everytime the lemon cake mix is on sale I always stock up. I usually add a little bit more lemon juice b/c I like the "kick" it adds to it. Great recipe. Thanks.

Very easy recipe and it tasted great! Instead of the lemon juice I used pure lemon extract. I also sprinkled some coconut over the cream cheese mixture before adding the rest of the cake mixture. Great lemon taste!
good, easy. Had to get a cake mix and a sugar free pudding mix. Not overly lemony or overly sweet, hubby liked it that way!
These were very dense and chewy, kind of like fudge-style brownies. They had a fruit-loops taste.
